Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Bruce J. McGiverin : as to Fernando L. Castillo-Morales (72). Arraignment and Bail Hearing Held. Present were AUSA Jose Capo and Elba Gorbea and Atty. Carlos Calderon. Defendant was present and assisted by court interpreter Tom Kavelin. Defendant waived reading of indictment. PONG entered as to both counts. Defendant is granted five (5) days to meet with the U. S. Attorney to obtain discovery and ten (10) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to bail, the government requested that the Court adopt the report and recommendation and order defendant detained. Defense counsel requested that defendant be given bail and ordered to be committed to an inpatient program. After hearing the parties, the Court granted bail at $10,000 unsecured and defendant is ordered to reside at an inpatient program designated by Pretrial Office. Defendant is not to return to any of the sites alleged in the indictment, to wit: El Puente, Dr. Pila Housing Project and El Tuque. (Court Reporter FTR.) (gsr, ) (Entered: 08/22/2007)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin :Detention Hearing as to Jose L. Rios-Santiago held on 8/23/2007. Defense counsel agreed with the bond recommendation made by Pretrial Services and argued in favor of setting conditions of release. The government did not object to the bond recommendation and requested a $5,000 secured bond, with electronic monitoring, and that the defendant not live in the Dr. Pila public housing project. The Court set bail at $5,000 secured, with home detention, electronic monitoring, seek or maintain employment, drug testing, plus all other standard conditions of release. The defendant is to live at the address suggested by defense counsel and mentioned in the Pretrial Services report. The defendant shall remain detained until the secured bond amount is posted. (AUSA Elba Gorbea. Atty Rafael Castro-Lang. PTS Guillermo Montanez. INT Annie Flores. CR FTR. CD Jyoti Mehta.) (jm, ) (Entered: 08/23/2007)

Defendant waived the reading of the indictment. Plea of not guilty entered as to Counts 1 - 3. The parties are granted 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Perez-Gimenez for trial setting. As to bail, the government agreed with the recommendation made by Pretrial Services and requested detention without bail. Defense counsel stated that they have no evidence to offer at this time, but reserve the right to reopen the bail issue if any information is obtained. The Court granted the government's request. The defendant is ordered detained pending trial. Order to issue. (SAUSA Eugenio Lomba. Atty Gustavo Del- Toro. PTS Mari Carmen Rios. INT Janis Palma. CR FTR. CD Jyoti Mehta.) Gm, ) (Entered: 08/24/2007)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas :Detention Hearing as to Juan Carlos Bodon-Lespier held on 8/29/2007. AUSA Julie Mosley and defense counsel Artemio Rivera-Rivera were present. The Government proffered as to defendant's role and/or participation in the case and requested detention without bail. Defense counsel had no evidence at this time, but will request to reserve the right to reopen the matter of bail. After hearing the parties, the Court finds defendant to be a risk of flight and danger to the community. Therefore, defendant is ordered detained without bail pending trial. Order will follow. If any additional evidence was to arise, defense counsel shall file motion.(Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez, CI: Edna Brayfield, PO: Liliana Mendez) (br) (Entered: 08/30/2007)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez :DeNovo Hearing as to Alexander Vargas-Velez held on 12/19/2007. AUSA-Jose Capo and attorney Miguel Montes were present. After meeting at side bar, the parties proposed to the Court that the defendant be allowed to be released on bail; conditions were discussed. Bail set in the amount of $10,000.00 cash or secured. The defendant is to reside at Urb. La Fe, Juana Diaz under Home Incarceration with electronic monitoring device. Defendant is NOT to visit the municipality of Ponce, nor Barrio Cotto Laurel, La Plena or La Corosa in Juana Diaz. Defendant shall report to the US Pretrial Services Officer weekly, at a date and time to be set by the PTS Officer. The defendant shall participate in a substance abuse treatment program to be selected by the US Pretrial Services Officer. If defendant wishes to work, he is to provide the information to PTS of potential employer for verification. (Court Reporter Joyce Del Valle.) (ja) (Entered: 12/20/2007)

Present were AUSA Jose Capo, Ms. Laura Maldonado and court interpreter Hilda Gutierrez. Defendant waived reading of indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. Minute Entry for proceedings held before JudgeUS Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Bail Hearing as to Ricardo Sierra-Rodriguez held on 1/23/2008. Present were AUSA Jose Capo, Ms. Laura Maldonado, PTO Wendy Moreno and court interpreter Hilda Gutierrez. Carlo, Esq. AUSA-Warren Vazquez and attorney Fernando Carlo were present. The defendant is questioned by the Court as to his reasons for requesting new counsel. Attorney Carlo vehemently petitions the Court to accept his withdrawal from the case based on defendant's statements made today and his affidavit at Dkt #699. Defendant's motion is denied. Attorney Carlo moves for reconsideration and informs the Court that the defendant is presently being advised by other attorneys and also by a private investigator. Reconsideration GRANTED. Mr. Carlo is to deposit his discovery file in the Clerk's Office for new counsel. The Court will appoint new counsel through a separate order. Torres-Salazar held on 3/11/2008 re 887 MOTION to Withdraw as Attorney by Ramon M. Gonzalez. filed by Jorge Fournier-Olavarria, 874 MOTION to Appoint Counsel filed by Jorge Fournier-Olavarria. Counsel met with the Court at side-bar. As a result of the bench conference, counsel informed that the issue of a possible conflict of interest has not materialized, so there is no reason why counsel cannot continue represting both defendants. Defendant Fournier (#18) addressed the Court stating that he would prefer that counsel only devote himself to his case and that new attorney be designated to defendant Torres-Salazar. Defendant Torres does not object suggestion made by deft Fournier and requests appointment of new counsel. The Court GRANTS defendants' request. Counsel to deposit his file of deft Torres with the Clerk of the Court and new counsel will be appointed to Mr. Torres. Defendant Fournier WITHDRAWS his motion to appoint new counsel at Dkt# 874. Motion by atty  Gonzalez to withdraw as counsel for deft Torres at Dkt# 887: Granted. Motions terminated as to Jorge Fournier-Olavarria, Luis B. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:Motion Hearing as to Reynaldo Rivera-Nadal held on 5/14/2008 re 1018 MOTION to Appoint Counsel filed by Reynaldo Rivera-Nadal. AUSA-Carmen Marquez and attorney Benito Rodriguez-Masso were present. Upon inquiry by the Court, defendant addressed the Court and stated his reasons for requesting new legal representation. Attorney Rodriguez-Masso stated his position. After hearing both parties, the Court DENIED defendant's pro-se request for new legal representation. The Court urged defendant to review the 2 boxes of CDs deposited at MDC for defendants to review at their leisure and to cooperate fully with his attorney in his defense. Although defense counsel informed that defendant's situation as to bail has not changed, he will review this matter and if necessary will file the pertinent motion for the Court's consideration. Motions terminated as to Reynaldo Rivera-Nadal: 1018 MOTION to Appoint Counsel filed by Reynaldo Rivera-Nadal. (Court Reporter FTR.) (ja) (Entered: 05/14/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Mag. Judge Justo Arenas:Foster Hearing as to Danny Guzman-Correa, Marisol Ramos-Pizarro held on 5/29/2008. Present were AUSA Scott Anderson and defense counsel PHV Ricardo Morel. Defendants filed Acknowledgment of Joint Representation Admonishment form. The Court advised defendants as to all possible consequences and difficulties that could be encountered by two defendants in one case being represented by the same attorney. Defendants stated they understood the explanation given and had no objection to both being represented by the same attorney. The Court approves the acknowledgment of joint representation. As to Nebbia Hearing, AUSA Anderson requested CJA expenses already provided to defendants be refunded and will file a motion, if necessary. Defense counsel informed the Court as defendant Danny Guzman-Correa, his mother in law will pay for his legal services and as to Marisol Ramos-Pizarro, her sisters are paying for his legal services. The Court requested defense counsel to file motion for Nebbia Hearing after an agreement with relatives is formalized.(CI Edna Brayfield, CD Elba Rivas) (Court Reporter FTR.) (er) (Entered: 05/29/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Bail Hearing as to Marisol Ramos-Pizarro held on 7/30/2008. AUSA Maritza Gonzalez and defense counsel Carlos Vazquez were present. The parties were heard by proffer. Defense counsel requested that the motion to continue, Dkt. 1458 , be granted to give time to produce medical reports, records and final results of defendant's health issues. Counsel requested that bond be granted and defendant may either reside with her sister, Celines Ramos, in Penuelas or her uncle in Juana Diaz. After having heard the parties, the Court set a bond as to Marisol Ramos-Pizarro (38) in the amount of $15,000 cash or secured by property. Standard release conditions imposed, wear an electronic monitoring device with home incarceration only for court appearances, meetings with counsel and medical appointments, must not reside in any housing project or visit any housing project or places mentioned or included in the indictment, submit to any method of testing required by the US Pretrial Division, participate in an in-patient our out- patient substance abuse therapy and/or counseling, refrain from obstructing or tampering with any testing or EMD. Once defense counsel receives defendant's medical report confirming her health, the same must be filed sealed. Motion 1458 is hereby moot. (Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez, PO: Evelyn Jimenez) (Court Interpreter Felix Toledo.) Hearing set for 09:30. Hearing held at 09:42. Hearing ended at 10:05. (br) (Entered: 07/30/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:Motion Hearing as to Freddy Soto-Rivera held on 8/11/2008 re 1491 MOTION Requesting Order re 1488 MOTION Requesting Order. AUSA-Jose Capo and attorney Juan Rodriguez were present. Both counsel and the defendant state their positions. After hearing the parties, the Court DENIED motion filed attorney Rodriguez requesting leave to withdraw as counsel, Dkt#1491. The Court instructed defense counsel to meet with the government to obtain a proffer of the evidence against the defendant and thereafter meet with his client and discuss the testimony of the witnesses against him. Motions terminated as to Freddy Soto-Rivera: 1491 MOTION Requesting Order re 1488 MOTION Requesting Order, Notice of Docket Text Modification. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:Sentencing held on 1/22/2009 for Javier Vazquez-Hernandez (11). Statements in support of mitigation of punishment are heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. Objections to the PSR raised by the defense are stated on the record. Despite the fact that the calculations within the PSR are correct, the Court will follow the recommendation within the plea agreement. Count(s) 1, Term of imprisonment: One hundred and forty-four (144) months to be served concurrently with the remainder of the sentence imposed in CR. 05-0417, Pursuant to USSG Section 5G1.3(b)(2). Concurrency of sentence will commence today. SRT of 10 years to be served concurrently with term imposed in CR. 05-0417. No fine. SMA of $100.00.; Count(s) 2, 3, Dismissed. (Court Reporter Joyce Del Valle.)(Court Interpreter Annie Flores.) Hearing set for 9:35 a.m. Hearing held at 11:00 a.m. Hearing ended at 11:30 a.m. (sr) Present: AUSA Myriam Fernandez, defense counsel Jose Novas. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPOs Merangelie Serrano and Miguel Berrios. (Entered: 01/23/2009)

Thereafter the Court reconvenes and defense counsel requested further time to discuss with client to which the Court stated that he would stay in Court and would give defense counsel five (5) minutes to further discuss certain matters. Thereafter, defense counsel informs the Court that after extensively discussing the plea agreement with client to which he thought that an agreement had been reached, there are certain aspects of the plea that have not been resolved and defendant will maintain his PONG and has decided to go to trial and not accept the plea. Counsel for the Government states that the Government is withdrawing the plea offered and will not entertain any further pleas as the Government will be preparing for trial. The Court inquires from the defendant who states that he does not wish to enter a plea of guilty and will proceed to go to trial. The Court states that trial shall be scheduled before Judge Perez-Gimenez. (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter N/A.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 10:07.Hearing ended at 10:15. (mn) (Entered: 03/13/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Present were AUSA Jose Capo, Mr. Ramon Gonzalez-Santiago, PTO Nancy Mendez. Bail Hearing as to Jorge Fournier-Olavarria held on 3/25/2009. The Court ordered the attorneys for the parties to meet in one of the jury rooms and review the defendant's medical records at MDC, provided by Dr. Ada Rivera, MDC's medical director, who was present in Court. After reviewing the record, speaking with the defendant, and sidebar meeting with the Court, the Court ruled that its only concern at this point was defendant's health, but that the issue of his health is not enough grounds to grant bail. The Court also stated that it would issue an order to MDC to evaluate defendant and provide treatment, including referral to a specialist if so needed, within the next ten days. Bail is denied, and docket entries number 2175 and 2335 are also denied. Order to issue. (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter Janis Palma.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 01:50.Hearing ended at 03:02. (yr) (Entered: 03/25/2009)

After being extensively questioned by the Court as to the contents of the Plea Agreement and as to his willingness to enter a plea of guilty as to counts one and two, the Court rejected defendant's plea of guilty. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:Case called for Status Conference as to Armando Ortiz-Melendez on 7/10/2009, but same was not held. AUSAs-Jose Capo and Myriam Fernandez were present. Defense attorney Francisco  Dolz had just left because the US Marshal failed to produce the defendant as ordered by the Court. The US Marshal's Office had been notified timely by e-mail to produce this defendant today and the Marshal's made no arrangements to produce him. Hence, today's conference/change of plea hearing was reset for Monday, July 20th at 9:30 AM. The Court ordered the US Marshal to produce the defendant on July 20th. The Court Reporter was instructed to prepare and file a transcript of today's proceedings in this case. The Court will send a copy of this transcript to the Director of the US Marshal's Services Office and to the Court Security Personnel at the US Marshal's main headquarters. (Court Reporter Joyce Del Valle.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 10:05.Hearing ended at 10:15. (ja) (Entered: 07/22/2009)

NOTICE RE REDACTION OF TRANSCRIPTS: The parties have seven (7) calendar days to file with the Court a Notice of Intent to Request Redaction of this transcript. Munute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez:Status Conference as to Edgardo Vega-Breban (19), Miguel Pacheco-Ortiz (21), William Figueroa-Gonzalez (48), and Carmen Nereida Rivera-Rivera (86) held on 10/2/2009. Present for the United States, AUSA Jose Capo. For the defendants Luis Guzman, Marie Cortes, and Ramon Garay. Counsel Vega-Pabon was substituted by Ramon Garay. Parties advised the Court as to the status of these particular defendants. As to co- defendant Figueroa-Gonzalez (48), Ex-parte motion, DE 2962 was discussed. Counsel Marie Cortes was granted as requested thirty (30) days in order to attempt to reach an agreement with the United States. As to co-defendant Edgardo Vega-Breban (19), counsel Guzman informed that he has not been evaluated yet as to his mental competency to stand trial. Counsel shall file a motion as soon the report is submitted in order for the Court to set a hearing. As to co-defendant Carmen Rivera (86), counsel Ramon Garay informed that she will be evaluated by Dr. Casanova Pelosi. As to Miguel Pacheco (21) counsel Ramon Garay on behalf of counsel Edgar Vega-Pabon informed that the defendant will go to trial. The Court advised counsel Vega-Pabon to file a motion to withdraw as counsel since there is a conflict that he represents the defendant at trial. Follow Up Deadline due by 11/2/2009. Hearing set for 02:00.Hearing held at 02:22.Hearing ended at 03:08. (om) (Entered: 10/06/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:Case called for sentencing hearing as to Jorge Quiles-Torres on 11/18/2009, but same was not held. AUSA-Sean Torriente and attorney Lydia Lizarribar were present. Defense counsel informed that her client has brought to her attention an issue as to defendant's criminal history category. Two prior convictions appear in this presentence report one of which is over twenty years old and the other was in 1990. Defendant contends that these two convictions should not be counted towards his criminal history category. The government sustains that defendant's second conviction was in 1992, but unaware of the date on which he was released. Defense counsel requests a continuance in order to verify the matter of his convictions. Sentence reset for November 25, 2009. Sentencing Hearing RESET for 11/25/2009 at 09:00 AM before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez: AUSA- Myriam Fernandez, attorney Luis Guzman-Dupont and Dr. Maria T. Margarida were present. Case called for Mental Competency Hearing as to Edgardo Vega-Breban on 12/14/2009, but same was NOT held. After meeting with the parties and Dr Margarida at side-bar, and after having read the reports submitted by the BOP and Dr Margarida which reach the same conclusion, the Court found that defendant is NOT suffering from a mental disorder which impedes him from understanding the proceedings against him nor assisting his attorney in his defense. Hence, the Court found defendant competent to stand trial. Defendant will remain committed until such time he decides to assist in his defense or face charges filed against him. Further, the Court may determine to send this defendant to an institution in the United States until he decides to take the appropriate steps in his defense. (Court Reporter Joyce Del Valle.)(Court Interpreter Annie Flores.)Hearing set for 10:30.Hearing held at 11:00.Hearing ended at 11:25. (ja) (Entered: 12/15/2009)

Therein, it shows attorney Luis R. Rivera Rodriguez appears as a retained counsel for defendant in the prosecution of his appeal of the judgment and sentence in this case. It further shows, that the Court of Appeals has yet to authorize defendant to proceed in Forma Pauperis before that Court. Therefore, defendant's "Motion Requesting Transcript Order First Day of Jury Trial Voir Dire Jury Impanelment Proceedings" (docket #3415) is hereby DENIED.Signed by Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez on 10/08/2010. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention as to Juan A. Ortiz-Negron (36) Count 1,2,3 held on 2/29/2012. Present: SAUSA Cesar Riverea and attorney Jennie M. Espada. Defendant is present and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Tania Correa also present. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. Case is referred to Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez for trial setting. As to bail, defense counsel informs she has no evidence to rebut the presumptions and findings in the PTS Report. However, reserves right to re-open the bail issue. Government's proffer heard and requests detention. Based on the nature of the charges and the defendant's role within the conspiracy, the Court finds that the defendant poses both a flight risk and a danger to the community, therefore, the defendant is ordered to remain under custody pending trial. Order to issue. (Court Reporter FTR.) Hearing set for 10:30 a.m. Hearing held at 11:05 a.m. Hearing ended at 11:08 a.m. Interpreter Enith Valdes. (sr) (Entered: 02/29/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:Status Conference as to Juan A. Ortiz-Negron held on 3/16/2012. AUSA-Jose Capo and attorney Jennie Espada were present. Voluminous discovery has been provided to defense counsel, including hundreds of incident reports. Government will provide a proffer of the testimony of cooperating witnesses. No itemized discovery will be produced. The defense informed that they are in the process of gathering documents which may be exculpatory in nature. Attorney Espada informed that for calendaring purposes she will be out of the jurisdiction from April 21st to May 2nd. With the amount of discovery provided the defense will not be ready to go to trial until the end of May 2012. The Government will also provide defense counsel with the trial transcripts and show her the Binders with the firearms seized in the case. A Further Status Conference set for 5/9/2012 at 10:00 AM in Old San Juan Courtroom before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez. Hearing set for 10:30.Hearing held at 10:55.Hearing ended at 11:00. Plea and Sentence Hearing held on 8/9/2012 as to Juan A. Ortiz-Negron (36). Defendant requested immediate imposition of sentence. Defense Counsel provided some background information. After listening to counsel, the Court finds that it has enough information on the record to meaningfully exercise its sentencing authority under 18 USC § 3553 without a pre-sentence investigation report, and, therefore, grants the defendants requests as authorized by Rule 32(c)(1)(A). Plea of guilty and sentencing on Count 1. Juan A. Ortiz-Negron (36) Dismissed counts Count 2,3. for Juan A. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Emmanuel Montes-Pagan held on 3/12/2014. Present were AUSA Marshal Morgan and AFPD Yasmin Irizarry. Defendant was present and under custody. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed and approved. Probable cause found and the matter was referred to the presiding judge for the full hearing. AFPD Irizarry stated for the record that the parties had spoken with the USPO and had agreed that defendant could continue under the same conditions of supervised release until the next hearing. The Government stated that this was correct. The Court advised defendant that he would continue under the same conditions of supervised release, including that he continue under treatment, and would be released today from custody, if there was no order to the contrary from the presider. The Court spoke with Judge Perez-Gimenez who had no opposition to defendant being released and vacated any further hearing on this matter, but advising defendant that if a new violation is notified, he will be arrested. The USM is to release defendant today under the same conditions of supervised release imposed at the time of sentencing. (Court Reporter - FTR.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:19.Hearing ended at 02:25. Interpreter - Carlos Lao. (yr) (Entered: 03/12/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Edwin Ortiz-Medina (76) held on 8/4/2014. AUSA Seth Erbe, and AFPD Vivianne Marrero were present. The defendant was present and was assisted by the official court interpreter. The defendant accepted that had violated the conditions of supervised release. Mitigation factors presented by the defense. After having heard both parties in this case, the Court made a finding that the defendant violated the conditions of the imposed supervised release term as cited in the motion filed by the United States Probation Office on June 23, 2014. Therefore, the supervised release term imposed on March 26, 2009 was revoked. The defendant was committed to the custody of the U.S. Marshals to be imprisoned for a term of Six (6) hours to be served at the U.S. Marshals Office. Supervised Release term of Five (5) years. Several special conditions imposed. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. All terms and conditions are specified at the judgment-revocation form. (Court Reporter Annette Montalvo.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 10:10.Hearing ended at 10:20.Interpreter Annie Flores. (om) (Entered: 08/04/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to William Febles-Laracuente (87) held on 3/5/2015. AUSA Nicolas Warren Cannon, and AFPD Thomas Trebilcock-Horan were present. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshals, and was assisted by the official court interpreter. The defendant did not contest the allegations made by the U.S. Probation Officer. The Court madea finding that the defendant violated the conditions of the imposed supervised release as stated by the motion filed by the U.S. Probation Officer at docket no. 4244. Therefore, the Supervised Release term imposed on February 2, 2015 was revoked. Imprisonment of 12 months imposed with no further supervision term to follow. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. The defendant was remanded to the custody of the U.S. Marshals. (Court Reporter Evilys Carrion.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 11:23.Hearing ended at 11:34 Interpreter Marie Hernandez. USPO Katherine Valentin (om) (Entered: 03/06/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Jorge Rivera-Diaz (77) held on 5/20/2015. Present were: AUSA Victor Acevedo, AFPD Hector Ramos and USPO Luz E. Aponte. Defendant present U/C and assisted by the court interpreter. Defense counsel informed that defendant wish to waive the hearing. Based upon the waiver, the Court approved the waiver and found proable cause that the defendant violated the conditions of supervised release. The case is referred to the presiding Judge for a final revocation hearing. As to detention, the parties agreed and the Court approved, that defendant shall remain under same conditons of supervised release once a bed is available at Santisima Trinidad. Upon Probation Office notice that a bed is available, the defendant shall be release from MDC Guaynabo directly to Santisima Trinida. (Court Reporter FTR.) Hearing set for 09:00. Hearing held at 09:30. Hearing ended at 09:32. Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez. (amr) (Entered: 05/20/2015)

Miunute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Fernando C. Martinez-Serrano (50) held on 7/10/2015. Present were AUSA Vanessa E. Bonhomme, and AFPD Carlos A. Vazquez. The defendant was present, under the custody of the U.S. Marshals, and was assisted by the official court interpreter. The defendant waived the full hearing, and accepted the allegations made at the motion filed at docket no. 4289 to wit; failure to notify the US Probation Officer within 72 hours of being arrested. Based on defendant's failure to comply with this standard condition of supervision no. 11, the Court revoked the supervised release term imposed on April 1, 2009. The defendant was sentenced to time served. Supervised Release term of five (5) years. The terms and conditions of supervised release previously imposed shall remain in effect. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 11:15.Hearing ended at 11:31 .Interpreter Edna Brayfield. USPO Carlina Cortes, USPO Alexandria Oliveras. (om) (Entered: 07/10/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez: Revocation of supervised release Hearing as to Jorge Rivera-Diaz (77) held on 7/10/2015 re 4328 Supplemental Motion re: 4295 MOTION to Show Cause re Revocation of Supervised Release filed by US Probation. Present were AUSA Edward Veronda, and AFPD Hector L. Ramos. The defendant was present in court, and was assisted by the official court interpreter. After having heard the parties in this case, the Court made a finding that the defendant violated the conditions of the imposed supervised release term by changing his residence without authorization and testing positive to illicit substances. However, the Court did not revoke defendant's supervised release term. Stern warning was given. The defendant shall continue participating in the residential substance abuse treatment at Santisima Trinidad. The defendant shall fully comply with his supervised conditions, and any other further violation shall be informed immediately to the Court, and adverse actions will be taken accordingly. As part of these conditions, the defendant shall be required to continue in treatment at Santisima Trinidad until discharged by the U.S. Probation Officer. All terms and conditions of the supervision conditions previously imposed shall remain in effect. (Court Reporter Evilys Carrion.)Hearing set for 10:00. Hearing held at 11:12.Hearing ended at 11:17.Interpreter Edna Brayfield. USPO Carlina Cortes, and USPO Alexandria Oliveras (om) (Entered: 07/14/2015)

Munute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Javier Acosta-Colon (81) held on 9/12/2016. Present were AUSA Seth Erbe, AFPD Francisco Celedonio and USPO Brenda Lee Nieves. The defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. The defendant accepted the allegations, and waived the hearing. Therefore, the Court made a finding that the defendant violated the conditions of supervised previously imposed. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defendant. Defendant's allocution heard. After having heard the parties, the Court imposed a sentence of TIME SERVED. Supervised Release term of 5 years, under the same conditions previously imposed. Additional conditions were imposed today that will be specified in the judgment. The defendant was also advised of his right to appeal. (Court Reporter Lisa O'Brien.) Hearing set for 2:00 pm. Hearing held at 2:33 pm. Hearing ended at 2:46 pm. Interpreter Felix Toledo. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jorge Rivera-Diaz (77) held on 6/30/2017. Present were AUSA Dina Avila, and AFPD Victor J. Gonzalez. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S Marshals and was assited by certified court interpreter. The defendant waived the hearing, and accepted the allegations as filed by the U.S. Probation Office. Counsel for the defendant proceeded to provide relevant mitigating circumstances to be considered by the Court. After hearing the parties, the Court made a finding that the defendant has violated the conditions of supervised release previously imposed. Imprisonment imposed of Twelve (12) months. Then the defendant shall participate in a residential reentry center ( halfway house) for a period of Six (6) months. SRT of five (5) years under the same supervised conditions previously imposed, and two (2) additional conditions imposed at today's proceedings. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. The defedant was remanded to the custody of the US Marshals. (Court Reporter Lisa O'Brien.)Hearing set for 11:30.Hearing held at 11:52. USPO Alejandro MartinezHearing ended at 12:05.Interpreter Felix Toledo. (om) (Entered: 07/07/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Orlando Melendez-Torres (47) held on 7/5/2017. Present were AUSA Susan Z. Jorgensen, and AFPD Juan J. Michelen. The defendant was present in court, under the previous supervised conditions previously imposed, and was assisted by certified court interpreter. The defendant waived the hearing and accepted the allegations as cited in the motion filed by the U.S. Probation Officer. Counsel for the defendant proceeded to provide relevant mitigating circumstances to be considered by the Court. After hearing the parties, the Court made a finding that the defendant has violated the conditions of supervised release previously imposed by changing address prior notifying his probation officer, utilizing illegal drugs, going to places where illegal controlled substances are sold, and associating with person engaged in criminal activity as cited in motions filed on April 24, and May 11, 2017. The defendant was committed to the custody of the U.S Marshals to be imprisoned for a term of Four (4) hours to be served today, July 5, 2017 at the cellblock located at the U.S Marshals Office located in Old San Juan Courthouse. Supervised release imposed of two (2) years. Home detention for a term of three (3) months. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. Cost of the Electronic Monitoring Device waived as requested. (Court Reporter Lisa O'Brien.)Hearing set for 10:30.Hearing held at 11:19.Hearing ended at 11:35.Interpreter Thomas Kavelin. USPO Linda Perez, SUSPO Yaritza Vazquez. (om) (Entered: 07/11/2017)

ORDER Directing USM as to Alex Colon-Carlo (33). On October 17, 2018, the Court issued an order setting this case for Revocation on Supervised Release for November

2018 and directing the U.S. Marshal to have the defendant brought back to this jurisdiction on or before November 23, 2018. See Docket No. 4750. The defense requested a continuance on November 28, 2018 (Docket No. 4762) because defendant was not transferred to PR in time for the hearing. In response to an email sent on my behalf by the Courtroom Deputy on November 29, 2018, the U.S. Marshals attempted to excuse their failure to comply with my order stating that there "was a back log of prisoners pending to be returned due to the quarantine back in October." The US Marshals disregard of this Court's orders and arbitrary determinations regarding which defendants will be brought back to this jurisdiction, and on what day, directly impacts the efficient prosecution and resolution of my cases. This cannot be allowed. The exigencies of this Court's docket mandates that the U.S. Marshals obey my orders. This Court emphasizes that the U.S. Marshal MUST comply with the Court's orders. Signed by Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez on 12/3/2018.(om) (Entered: 12/07/2018)

COPY of the minute entry entered in Cr. 18-141 PG as to Alex Colon-Carlo (33). Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez: Pretrial Conference as to Alex Colon-Carlo (1) held on December 14, 2018 as to this case, and the pending revocation in Cr. 07-290-33 PG. Present AUSA Desiree Laborde- Sanfiorenzo for AUSA Kelly Zenon-Matos, and AFPD Javier A. Cuyar-Olivo. Parties informed the status of this case. The United States has provided all discovery, and no plea offer will be tendered in this case, and jury trial was requested to be set. In this case, the United States filed an Amended Information to Establish prior convictions pursuant to 21 USC 851. Jury trial in this case already set for January 14, 2019. Counsel Cuyar informed that an evidence inspection will be coordinated, and additional discovery was requested. Hence, time for the inspection of the evidence, and for the filing of dispositive motions was requested. The Court after hearing the parties, made the following rulings. As requested by the defense, Jury trial set for January 14, 2019 was vacated. A final Pretrial Conference set for January 14, 2019 at 10:00 a.m. At this conference the Court will set the deadlines for the filing of dispositive motions. Finally, the Court informed that revocation hearing will be held first, and then the Jury trial. (Court Reporter Cindy L. Brown.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 11:05.Hearing ended at 11:30. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jose De-Jesus-Morales (42) held on December 19, 2018. Present were AUSA Camille Garcia-Jimenez, and AFPD Juan J. Michelen. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshals, and assisted by certified court interpreter. The defendant waived the hearing, and accepted the allegations as filed at docket no. 4752 by the U.S. Probation Office. Counsel for the defendant proceeded to provide relevant mitigating circumstances to be considered by the Court. Counsel for the defendant requested a term of the middle range of the guideline be imposed. After hearing the parties, the Court made a finding that the defendant has violated the conditions of supervised release previously imposed as stated at the motion filed by the U.S. Probation Officer at docket 4752 , and supervised release previously imposed on March 27, 2009 was revoked. Prior of imposing a term of imprisonment, the Court stated for the record defendant's numerous violations of supervised release, and findings on why the term of imprisonment should be imposed. The defendant was sentenced to a term of Three (3) years to be followed by a term of supervised release of two (2) years. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. Reconsideration requested. In addition, as part of the reconsideration requested, that no further supervised release be imposed. Reconsideration was denied. The defendant was remanded to the custody of the U.S. Marshals. (Court Reporter Donna Goree.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 11:44.Hearing ended at 12:28 Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. USPO David Vazquez. (om) (Entered: 12/19/2018)

Munute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Juan Carlos Bodon-Lespier (56) held on May 8, 2019. Present AUSA Alexander L. Alum, and AFPD Yasmin A. Irizarry. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshal, and assisted by certified court interpreter Ani Navarro. The defendant waived the hearing, and accepted the allegations as filed by the U.S. Probation Office at ECF No. 4839 . Counsel for the defendant proceeded to provide relevant mitigating circumstances to be considered by the Court, and requested 5 months of imprisonment plus 6 months in a halfway house, and additional supervised release term. The United States requested 11 months of imprisonment. After hearing the parties, the Court made a finding that the defendant has violated the conditions of supervised release previously imposed as stated at the motion filed by the U.S. Probation Officer at ECF No. 4839 . Hence, supervised release previously imposed on May 5, 2019 was revoked. The defendant was sentenced to 5 months of imprisonment, and upon release from imprisonment he shall participate in a residential reentry center (halfway house) for a period of 6 months. Supervised Release term of 12 months. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. (Court Reporter Robin Dispenzieri.)Hearing set for 11:00.Hearing held at 11:10.Hearing ended at 11:39 Interpreter Ani Navarro. USPO Emmanuel Maldonado. (om) (Entered: 05/09/2019)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Carmen Nereida Rivera-Rivera (86) held on 7/12/2019. Present: AUSA Sean Gajewski, AFPD Melanie Matos, USPO Alexandria Oliveras. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Counsel for defendant informed that they are waiving the hearing. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing was filed. The Court approved the same and made a finding of probable cause. Case is referred to Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez for setting of Final Revocation Hearing. Defense counsel requested that the defendant be placed in an inpatient drug treatment program. Neither the government nor the probation office had any objection. Therefore, the parties are all in agreement that the defendant should be released to an inpatient drug treatment program pending the final revocation hearing, one of the reasons being the defendant's health issues. The Court is inclined to follow the recommendation and issue an order for her release as he is authorized to do by Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 32.1(a)(6). However, there is an order from the presiding district judge entered at docket 4865 which orders the defendant to remain detained. The Court is, therefore, bound by that order. Defendant's request for release is directly referred to Judge Perez-Gimenez. (Court Reporter DCR/ Courtroom 9.) Hearing set for 11:00. Hearing held at 11:14. Hearing ended at 11:20. Interpreter Olga Uribe. (bgl) (Entered: 07/12/2019)

Further instructions on how to access, Id and password will follow by email. By no later than May 15, 2020 defendant shall file an informative motion indicating if he consents to have this proceeding via VTC. Minute Entry for proceedings held before U.S. District Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Juan Carlos Bodon-Lespier (56) held on June 1, 2020. Present: AUSA Pedro Casablanca, and AFPD Victor J. Gonzalez-Bothwell. The record should reflect the proceedings are being held by VTC, given the emergency situation created by the COVID-19 pandemic. Therefore, the defendant has consented to proceed by VTC, and defendant has secured a waiver to that effect that appears on the record filed at ECF No. 4934 and 4935. Certified court interpreter Mayra Cardona was acting and assisting the defendant on a secured line, as well, at Bayamon 705 and the Court had a clear view of him on screen. The defendant waived the hearing, and accepted the violations of the conditions of supervised release by commiting a criminal offense while being under supervised release as stated by the U.S. Probation Office at ECF No. 4897. After hearing the parties, the Court made a finding that the defendant has violated the conditions of supervised release previously imposed. Supervised Release term previously imposed on May 8, 2019 was revoked. Imprisonmet of TIME SERVED, with no further supervisions to follow. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. (Court Reporter Lisa O'Brien.)Hearing set for 11:15.Hearing held at 11:40.Hearing ended at 12:05 Interpreter Mayra Cardona. USPO Rosangela Lugo. (om) (Entered: 06/01/2020)

No later than May 18, 2021, the government and the probation officer will respond to this motion to terminate defendant's supervised release term. In her response, the probation officer will state the "special, exceptional or unforeseen circumstances" that warrant defendant's early termination of his supervised release term.
